item.description:
Since the Mt Major hike has been posponed until June 3rd,  how about a nice walk along the rail trail at Lake Massabesic.

 

Plunk loves this area as there are ooodles of awesome smells !

 

We will probably do about 6 to 7 miles round trip depending on the group.  I generally start from the parking lot of the beach/park for Lake Massabesic (just off the Massabesic Circle and across the street from the baseball park).

 

We'll meet here at 11 am and saddle up for a nice walk in the woods along the lake.

 

Hope you will join us....woof woof

 

Plunk and JJJ

If you are traveling on Interstate 93 in Manchester get off at exit 7 to head onto NH-101 East.  Take Exit 1  on NH-101 (which is the next exit).  At the end of the ramp turn right onto Londonderry Turnpike  (If you are on NH 101 heading west at the end of the ramp for exit one turn left)  Go straight proceeding 0.2 miles to the Massabesic Traffic Circle and enter the traffic circle.  Proceed half way around the traffic circle and leave the circle, taking the second right to exit onto the Londonderry Turnpike (also known as bypass 28).  Proceed 184 feet and turn left into the parking lot.  If the parking lot is full you could also park across the street at the ball field parking lot.
item.how_to_find_us: Cute Beagle Screaming Over Here......Over Here !!!

group.name: Human Soles & Doggie Paws Hikers & Walkers of Manchester, NH

item.name: Dog walk along Rail Trail at Lake Massabesic
